Package gw.api.contact

Class ContactRetireHelper

java.lang.Object
gw.api.contact.ContactRetireHelper
public class ContactRetireHelper extends Object
This class is the helper class that implements the retiring of Contacts.

  • Method Details

    • retireContact

      public static boolean retireContact(Contact contact)
      Attempt to retire the contact passed in. This will check for FK references to the contact and will not retire it if any entities found to link to the contact reject retiring of the contact.

      Entities that have links to Contact through array references can implement the ContactRetireBean interface to indicate if the contact can be retired based on the link to that entity, otherwise they will not cause the retirement to be stopped.

      Non array links to entities will cause the rejection of the attempt to retire the contact.
      Parameters:
      contact - - the contact to be retired
      Returns:
      boolean indicating if the contact was retired
      See Also:
      • ContactRetireBean

    • retireContact

      public static boolean retireContact(String contactPublicID)
      Attempt to retire the contact passed in. This will check for FK references to the contact and will not retire it if any entities found to link to the contact reject retiring of the contact.

      Entities that have links to Contact through array references can implement the ContactRetireBean interface to indicate if the contact can be retired based on the link to that entity, otherwise they will not cause the retirement to be stopped.

      Non array links to entities will cause the rejection of the attempt to retire the contact.
      Parameters:
      contactPublicID - - the PublicID of the contact to be retired
      Returns:
      boolean indicating if the contact was retired
      See Also:
      • ContactRetireBean

    • computeCanRetireContact

      public static boolean computeCanRetireContact(Contact contact, ContactRetireContext retireContext)
      Returns true if the contact passed in can be retired. The properties which represent foreign keys to contact are split into two groups : those deemed safe to retire with the Contact and those that are not safe to retire. The set of safe properties is obtained from the IRetireContactPlugin#getSafePropertiesForContactRetirement() method. The set of non-safe properties is obtained from the list of foreign key references to Contact less the safe properties.

      If there are instances of the safe properties, the entities holding those properties are retired along with the contact, i.e. the are added to the retireContext's beansToRetire set.

      If there are instances of non-safe properties, the entities holding those properties are checked to see if they implement the ContactRetireBean interface. If they do the computeCanRetireBeanForContactProperty() method is called to see if this instance of the Contact can be retired for that property on the entity. If it can then the contact can be retired, if not the Contact is prevented from being retired.

      The method will add any beans in the Contact's graph that can also be retired to the retireContext's set of beans to retire and any visited beans to the retireContext's set of visited beans. When processing beans for retirement, the retireContext's visitedBeans set should be checked to ensure that no cycle in the graph causes an infinite loop of processing.

      If you implement the ContactRetireBean interface and need to process any Contacts while processing the array entity, then you should use this method to process them

      Parameters:
      contact - the contact to check for retirement
      retireContext - the context wrapper for the contact retire operation
      Returns:
      boolean if the contact can be retired

    • createContactRetireWorkItem

      public static void createContactRetireWorkItem(Contact contact)
      Creates a work item for the ContactRetireWorkQueue for a Contact that may be eligible to be retired.
      Parameters:
      contact - the contact which which should be checked to see if it can be retired.
